newsitem.title: USA: Community Central Bank files for public offering.
newsitem.headline: Community Central Bank files for public offering.

text.p: Community Central Bank Corp said it registered with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission a proposed initial public offering of 825,000 shares of common stock at $10 each.
All of the 825,000 shares will be newly issued and sold by the company.
Underwriters, including Roney & Co, have been granted an option by Community Central Bank to buy up to an additional 123,750 shares to cover any overallotments.
Community Central Bank Corp said it applied to become a registered bank holding company owning all of the outstanding stock of Community Central Bank.

Community Central Bank is currently being formed in Mount Clemons, Mich. Its assets include expected proceeds from the IPO. The bank will target small and mid-sized businesses and consumers in Macomb County, Mich., which has a population of more than 700,000 people and 15,000 businesses.
The stock symbol for Community Central Bank is expected to be "CCBD."
